documentation.text: @notice Emitted when a new option contract is purchased
@notice Emitted when an option contract is exercised
@notice Name of the adapter. E.g. "HEGIC", "OPYN_V1". Used as index key for adapter addresses

@notice Boolean flag to indicate whether to use option IDs or not.
 Fungible protocols normally use tokens to represent option contracts.
@notice Returns the purchase method used to purchase options

@notice Check if an options contract exist based on the passed parameters.
 @param optionTerms is the terms of the option contract

@notice Get the options contract's address based on the passed parameters
 @param optionTerms is the terms of the option contract

attributes.text: @notice Emitted when a new option contract is purchased
@notice Emitted when an option contract is exercised
@notice Name of the adapter. E.g. "HEGIC", "OPYN_V1". Used as index key for adapter addresses

@notice Boolean flag to indicate whether to use option IDs or not.
 Fungible protocols normally use tokens to represent option contracts.
@notice Returns the purchase method used to purchase options

@notice Check if an options contract exist based on the passed parameters.
 @param optionTerms is the terms of the option contract

@notice Get the options contract's address based on the passed parameters
 @param optionTerms is the terms of the option contract

params.amount: is the amount of tokens or options contract to exercise. Only relevant for fungle protocols like Opyn
params.optionID: is the ID of the option position in non fungible protocols like Hegic.
params.options: is the address of the options contract
params.recipient: is the account that receives the exercised profits. This is needed since the adapter holds all the positions and the msg.sender is an instrument contract.

params.amount: is the amount of tokens or options contract to exercise. Only relevant for fungle protocols like Opyn
params.optionID: is the ID of the option position in non fungible protocols like Hegic.
params.options: is the address of the options contract

params.optionTerms: is the terms of the option contract
is the terms of the option contract
is the terms of the option contract
params.purchaseAmount: is the number of options purchased

params.amount: is the purchase amount in Wad units (10**18)
params.optionTerms: is the terms of the option contract

Exercised(address,address,uint256,uint25.notice: Emitted when an option contract is exercised

Purchased(address,string,address,address.notice: Emitted when a new option contract is purchased

exerciseProfit(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Amount of profit made from exercising an option contract (current price - strike price). 0 if exercising out-the-money.

getOptionsAddress((address,address,addre.notice: Get the options contract's address based on the passed parameters

nonFungible().notice: Boolean flag to indicate whether to use option IDs or not. Fungible protocols normally use tokens to represent option contracts.

optionsExist((address,address,address,ui.notice: Check if an options contract exist based on the passed parameters.

premium((address,address,address,uint256.notice: Gets the premium to buy `purchaseAmount` of the option contract in ETH terms.

protocolName().notice: Name of the adapter. E.g. "HEGIC", "OPYN_V1". Used as index key for adapter addresses

purchaseMethod().notice: Returns the purchase method used to purchase options
